messages.content: I live in Mile End, Montreal. The murals and bilingual banter.
That sounds wonderful! What do you enjoy most about living there?
Every Saturday I love bagels at St-Viateur then browsing Mile End record shops.
That sounds like a great weekend routine!
My neighbor Jean-Pierre, a jazz musician who plays saxophone on his balcony. We've become good friends.
It's nice to have friendly neighbors!
For breakfast I usually have smoked meat sandwich and coffee at Beautys Luncheonette.
Sounds delicious!
I'm relocating to Mission District, San Francisco for an art residency!
That's exciting! What are you looking forward to?
My Saturday routine will be morning at Dolores Park then tacos at La Taqueria.
Sounds amazing!
I hear the breakfast scene is great — I plan to have chilaquiles and drip coffee at Ritual on Valencia Street.
You'll love it there!
I've been in Mission District, San Francisco for a few weeks now. I love the murals and Mission burrito culture.
How are you settling in?
Great! My neighbor Carlos, an artist who runs a gallery and invites me to openings.
What a wonderful connection!
I'm relocating to Gracia, Barcelona for a language immersion program!
That's exciting! What are you looking forward to?
My Saturday routine will be exploring Mercat de l'Abaceria then walking to Park Güell.
Sounds amazing!
I hear the breakfast scene is great — I plan to have bikini sandwich and café con leche at a plaça terrace.
You'll love it there!
I've been in Gracia, Barcelona for a few weeks now. I love the village-like plazas and Gaudí mosaics nearby.
How are you settling in?
Great! My neighbor Montse, a flamenco dancer who practices on the rooftop.
What a wonderful connection!

sessions.topic: Moving to Hoi An Old Town

messages.content: I'm relocating to Hoi An Old Town, Vietnam for a company transfer!
That's exciting! What are you looking forward to?
My Saturday routine will be morning at the Central Market then tailoring a custom ao dai.
Sounds amazing!
I hear the breakfast scene is great — I plan to have cao lầu and Vietnamese iced coffee at a riverside stall.
You'll love it there!

sessions.topic: Life in Hoi An Old Town

messages.content: I've been in Hoi An Old Town, Vietnam for a few weeks now. I love the paper lanterns and ancient merchant houses.
How are you settling in?
Great! My neighbor Linh, a lantern maker who teaches me traditional craft techniques.
What a wonderful connection!
I'm relocating to Marrakech Medina, Morocco for a research fellowship!
That's exciting! What are you looking forward to?
My Saturday routine will be getting lost in the souks then mint tea at a riad courtyard.
Sounds amazing!
I hear the breakfast scene is great — I plan to have msemen and fresh orange juice at a stall in Jemaa el-Fna.
You'll love it there!
I've been in Marrakech Medina, Morocco for a few weeks now. I love the spice aromas and zellige tilework everywhere.
How are you settling in?
Great! My neighbor Fatima, a henna artist who teaches me Arabic calligraphy.
What a wonderful connection!
I'm relocating to Jongno, Seoul for a consulting contract!
That's exciting! What are you looking forward to?
My Saturday routine will be visiting Insadong galleries then traditional tea at a hanok teahouse.
Sounds amazing!
I hear the breakfast scene is great — I plan to have hotteok and barley tea from a street vendor near Bukchon.
You'll love it there!
I've been in Jongno, Seoul for a few weeks now. I love the hanok rooftops and palace walls.
How are you settling in?
Great! My neighbor Soo-jin, a calligrapher who teaches me basic hangul brushwork.
What a wonderful connection!

queries.question: Who is my neighbor based on where I live now?

reference_answer.text: Since you currently live in Jongno, Seoul, your neighbor is Soo-jin, a calligrapher who teaches me basic hangul brushwork. The answer should NOT mention neighbors from your previous cities (Mile End Jean-Pierre, Mission District Carlos, Gracia Montse, Hoi An Old Town Linh, Marrakech Medina Fatima).
